definition: to be precisely the same/to be no different
as/as if/such as

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
rut/track/rhyme/(dialect) way/method
to remove/to withdraw

sentences.english: But the origins of our problem are pretty much the same.
sentences.chinese: 但是，當前問題的根源卻幾乎是如出一轍。

sentences.english: In this regard regulators are ploughing the same furrow as before.
sentences.chinese: 在這個方面，監管者的表現與以往如出一轍。

sentences.english: Hu Xuebing can use gypsum as skillfully as his ancestors.
sentences.chinese: 胡學兵對於石膏的純熟運用和他的祖先如出一轍。

sentences.english: This is the story of hardships known Gou same.
sentences.chinese: 這與家喻戶曉的勾踐臥薪嚐膽的典故如出一轍。

sentences.english: The '09 Geely GE body design is no doubt a knock-off of the Rolls Royce Phantom.
sentences.chinese: 09款吉利GE的車身設計與勞斯萊斯幻影如出一轍。

sentences.english: Charless scored again, with an exact duplicate of his first goal.
sentences.chinese: 查爾斯再次得分，與第一次破門如出一轍。

sentences.english: Operate exactly the same with the map search.
sentences.chinese: 操作起來跟地圖搜索時如出一轍。

sentences.english: Another doctor Zhiyang has been murdered, and the crime scene is exactly the same as that of Xiong Zhong's.
sentences.chinese: 又一醫生智揚被殺害，兇殺現場和祥忠的如出一轍。

sentences.english: Today, he to your enticement also with beforehand being exactly the same.
sentences.chinese: 今天，他對你的誘惑也跟以前的如出一轍。

definition: to inherit/to follow/to adopt
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
to run in the opposite direction (idiom); to run counter to
to agree without prior consultation/to happen to hold the same view
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
countless changes/constant permutation
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
analogy/(Tw) (electronics) analog
to try hard to/to strive to
advanced guard/vanguard/avant-garde/forward (soccer position)
unprecedented/never seen before
to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
a struggle/fight/battle
axle/(fig.) central element/key element/axis (alliance of nations)
to agree by chance (idiom); taking the same action without prior consultation
